page.title: 01Cairndow
page.content: Cairndow is a wee place.It has two farms,a sawmill, a church and a school.Only about 80 people live in Cairndow.There are only three pupils in our school. The houses in Cairndow are beside Loch Fyne. Most of the land is used for farming sheep and cattle. Cairndow has very pretty gardens and also has the tallest tree in Britain. The tourists visit the church because of its peculiar shape. There is a very steep hill called the Rest and Be Thankful and in the winter it is usually blocked with snow and lots of people get stuck on it. They have to be escorted down by the Police. Cairndow is a quiet peaceful place.
